title: Seabeam Bathymetry Imagery by Station - HLY-02-01 [USCG]
Summary: This dataset contains .png SeaBeam bathymetry images for each station along the HLY-02-01 cruise. Please note that events marked on the plots correspond to specific sampling periods during each station.

title: Seabeam Bathymetry Imagery by Station - HLY-02-03 [USCG]
Summary: This data set contains .png SeaBeam bathymetry images for each station along the HLY-02-03 cruise. Please note that events marked on the plots correspond to specific sampling periods during each station.

title: HLY-04-02 Ice Algal and Phytoplankton Photophysiological Measurements [Gradinger, R.]
Summary: This data set includes data obtained from water and ice samples that were collected in the Chukchi and Beaufort shelves and slope regions during the spring 2004 SBI expedition onboard the U.S. Coast Guard Cutter (USCGC) Healy between May 21 and June 21, 2004. This data set includes ice algal and phytoplankton photophysiological measurements.

title: HLY-02-01 Ice Algal and Phytoplankton Photophysiological Measurements [Gradinger, R.]
Summary: This data set includes data obtained from water and ice samples that were collected in the Chukchi and Beaufort shelves and slope regions during the spring 2002 SBI expedition onboard the U.S. Coast Guard Cutter (USCGC) Healy between May 10 and June 3, 2002. Ice algal and phytoplankton photophysiological measurements are included in this data set.

title: Physical/chemical/biological sea ice characteristics [Gradinger, R.]
Summary: The data set consists of the sea ice measurements conducted at 10 stations between 21 May 2004 and 14 June 2004 as part of the SBI project, including location, snow thickness, ice temperature, salinity, nutrients, chlorophyll a (chl a), and phaeopigments values. See the readme file for an explanation of the methodology used to obtain these data.

title: Primary Production Estimate of Sea Ice Algae [Gradinger, R.]
Summary: This data set includes Primary Production Estimates of Sea Ice Algae collected during the SBI spring U.S. Coast Guard Cutter (USCGC) Healy 2002 cruise. See the readme file for an explanation of the methodology used to obtain these data.

title: Sea Ice Permeability (csv) [Eicken, H.]
Summary: This data set comprises sea ice permeability measurements on 5cm ice core sections. The ice cores were collected in May and June 2002 and 2004 during the Shelf-Basin-Interactions (SBI) spring U.S. Coast Guard Cutter (USCGC) Healy Process cruises into the eastern Chukchi and western Beaufort Sea. This dataset includes the .csv format of the data. See the companion dataset for .xls format.

title: Sea Ice Permeability (xls) [Eicken, H.]
Summary: This data set comprises sea ice permeability measurements on 5cm ice core sections. The ice cores were collected in May and June 2002 and 2004 during the Shelf-Basin-Interactions (SBI) spring U.S. Coast Guard Cutter (USCGC) Healy Process cruises into the eastern Chukchi and western Beaufort Sea. This data set includes the .xls format of the data. See the companion dataset for .csv format.

title: SBI HLY-04-02 Zooplankton [Smith, S.](Excel format)
Summary: Zooplankton samples were collected from the United States Coast Guard Cutter (USCGC) Healy between 24 May and 21 June 2004 (cruise designation HLY0402). Sampling focused on the shelf and slope regions in the northeastern Chukchi Sea and western Beaufort Sea. Samples were collected with vertically hauled Bongo nets with a 60 cm diameter net-mouth and 150 m and 335 m mesh nets (Sea-Gear Corporation), or with a Hydro-Bios MultiNet plankton sampler with a 0.25 m2 net mouth fitted with 150 m mesh nets, pressure sensor and flowmeter. These data are provided in Excel spreadsheet format.

title: 2003 Helo Survey Nutrients and Oxygen Isotope Samples [Christensen, J. and H. Melling]
Summary: As part of the Shelf-Basin Interactions (SBI) project, early spring sampling was performed in the eastern area of the SBI study area using aircraft. Flights began on 1 April 2003 and finished on 15 April. During this time, we sampled 42 sites (49 Conductivity Temperature Depth (CTD) casts) on a series of 5 transect lines which bracketed and were parallel to the SBI current meter mooring line located at 152 W longitude. Stations were about 10 km apart along each transect line. A map of the achieved sampling sites is available (file: Sw3loc4a.pdf) and station locations, sampling dates and times are found in the file, Sw3vit-4.csv. At each site, a Seabird CTD (either a SBE-19 or an SBE-25) and Satlantic ISUS nitrate analyzer with a water sampling bottle was deployed through an 8 inch hole augured through the pack-ice. Continuous profiles of pressure, temperature, salinity, and nitrate concentrations were made from the ice hole to either the sediment surface or to about 390 m and were binned into 0.5 dbar bins. Data from the vertical profiles of temperature, salinity, and density are contained in another dataset. Approximately 60 of seawater were collected from up to 8 sampling depths. Waters were subdivided into 30 ml for dissolved nutrient analyses and 20 ml for determination of the isotopic ratio of 18-O/16-O in the sea water. Samples were frozen for return to Maine. Nutrients (nitrate, nitrite, ammonium, inorganic phosphate, and dissolved silica) were determined by autoanalyzer at the Scripps Institute of Oceanography Nutrient Chemistry Laboratory according to World Ocean Circulation Experiment (WOCE) protocols. The oxygen isotope samples were determined at the University of Maine's Stable Isotope Laboratory with standard mean ocean water as standard. The data are in csv format.

title: 2003 Helo Survey ISUS Nitrate Concentrations, Temperature, Salinity, and Density [Christensen, J. and H. Melling]
Summary: As part of the Shelf-Basin Interactions (SBI) project, early spring sampling was performed in the eastern area of the SBI study area using aircraft. Flights began on 1 April 2003 and finished on 15 April. During this time, we sampled 42 sites (49 Conductivity Temperature Depth (CTD) casts) on a series of 5 transect lines which bracketed and were parallel to the SBI current meter mooring line located at 152 W longitude. Stations were about 10 km apart along each transect line. A map of the achieved sampling sites is available (file: Sw3loc4a.pdf) and station locations, sampling dates and times are found in the file, Sw3vit-4.csv. At sites 10 through 49, a Seabird CTD (SBE-25) and Satlantic In-Situ Ultraviolet Spectrophotometer (ISUS) nitrate analyzer with a water sampling bottle was deployed through an 8 inch hole augured through the pack-ice. Continuous profiles of pressure, temperature, salinity, and ISUS-sensed nitrate concentrations were made from the ice hole to either the sediment surface or to about 390 m. The ISUS was not used at CTD casts 1 through 9. CTD data were processed with Seabird software (Seasoft) and the data binned into 0.5 dbar layers. All basic CTD data are contained in another dataset as well as the nutrient data collected from the water sampling bottles. The ISUS samples at a relatively slow rate (3.5 Hz), and even though repeated vertical profiles were collected at each site, not all pressure bins contained ISUS measurements. Data herein include basic CTD data as well as the ISUS data (in its respective bin) converted to nitrate concentration, and the continuous ISUS nitrate profiles constructed by linearly interpolating binned data between two vertically adjacent ISUS averages. A complete description of the evaluation procedure for these ISUS data is being prepared for publication, so data herein are considered to be in draft form. The data are in csv format.

title: SBI HLY-04-03 Zooplankton [Smith, S.] (Excel format)
Summary: Zooplankton samples were collected from the United States Coast Guard Cutter (USCGC) Healy between 22 July and 24 August 2004 (cruise designation HLY0403). Sampling focused on the shelf, slope, and basin regions in the northeastern Chukchi Sea and western Beaufort Sea. Samples were collected with a Hydro-Bios MultiNet plankton sampler with a 0.25 m2 net mouth fitted with 150 um mesh nets, pressure sensor and flowmeter. These data are provided in Excel spreadsheet format.

title: 2004 Winter Survey Profiles of Temperature, Salinity, Density and Nutrients [Christensen, J.]
Summary: As part of the Shelf-Basin Interactions (SBI) project, early spring sampling was performed in the eastern area of the Shelf-Basin Interactions Project using aircraft. Flights began on 1 April 2004 and finished on 16 April 2004. During this time, we sampled 32 sites on a series of 5 transect lines (Fig. 1). Stations were about 10 km apart along each transect line. Transect lines B, C, and D were at the same spacing; while, lines A and E were 20 km from the nearest transect line. Typically, 4 stations were sampled on each flying day. At each site, a Seabird SBE-19 Conductivity Temperature Depth (CTD) and a water sampling bottle was deployed through an 25 cm hole augered through the pack-ice. Continuous profiles of pressure, temperature, and salinity were made from the ice hole to either the sediment surface or to about 500 m. CTD data were processed with Seabird software (Seasoft) and the data binned into 0.5 dbar layers. Data herein are the vertical profiles of temperature, salinity, and density. About 30 ml of seawater collected from the Niskin bottle were poured into a 50 ml clean dry polyethylene sample bottle. The nutrient sample bottles quickly froze and were kept that way until measurement of nitrate, nitrite, ammonium, phosphate and silicate by the Nutrient Chemistry Laboratory of the Scripps Institute of Oceanography.

title: Moored ADCP Observations 2002-2003 from the Beaufort Shelf Edge Mooring Array [Pickart, R., P. S. Fratantoni, D. J. Torres]
Summary: This data set contains Acoustic Doppler Current Profiler (ADCP) data gathered from the Beaufort Shelf Edge Mooring Array which was deployed in July 2002 and recovered in September 2003 as part of the Shelf-Basin Interactions (SBI) project.

title: Moored Profiler Observations 2002-2003 from the Beaufort Shelf Edge Mooring Array [Pickart, R., P. S. Fratantoni, D. J. Torres]
Summary: This data set contains underwater profile data gathered from the Beaufort Shelf Edge Mooring Array which was deployed in July 2002 and August of 2002 and recovered in September 2003 as part of the Shelf-Basin Interactions (SBI) project.

title: Moored Profiler Observations 2003-2004 from the Beaufort Shelf Edge Mooring Array [Pickart, R., P. S. Fratantoni, D. J. Torres]
Summary: This data set contains underwater profile data gathered from the Beaufort Shelf Edge Mooring Array which was deployed in October 2003 and recovered in September 2004 as part of the Shelf-Basin Interactions (SBI) project.

title: Moored ADCP Observations 2003-2004 from the Beaufort Shelf Edge Mooring Array [Pickart, R., P. S. Fratantoni, D. J. Torres] (Matlab format)
Summary: This data set contains underwater Acoustic Doppler Current Profiler (ADCP) data gathered from the Beaufort Shelf Edge Mooring Array which was deployed in October 2003 and recovered in September 2004 as part of the Shelf-Basin Interactions (SBI) project.

title: HLY-04-04 Service Group CTD Data (WHP Format) [Service Group]
Summary: This data set consists of Conductivity, Temperature, Depth (CTD) Data in WHP Format from the Fall 2004 U.S. Coast Guard Cutter (USCGC) Healy cruise (HLY-04-04). The data are in a single zip file which contains a comma-delimited data file for each observation. Note that these data are final.

title: HLY-04-02 NCAR EOL Service Group Cruise CD [NCAR EOL Service Group]
Summary: This CD ROM was created 22 June 2004 at the end of the SBI Spring Cruise aboard the U.S. Coast Guard Cutter (USCGC) Healy. It is a subset of the NCAR EOL HLY-04-02 field catalog and contains the data in the state they were in as of the end of the cruise. At that time, the Conductivity Temperature Depth (CTD) and bottle data were in their final form. The state (preliminary or final) of all other datasets on this CD was unknown at that time.

title: HLY-04-03 NCAR EOl Service Group Cruise CD [NCAR EOL Service Group]
Summary: This CD ROM was created 25 August 2004 at the end of the SBI U.S. Coast Guard Cutter (USCGC) Healy Summer Cruise. It is a subset of the NCAR EOL HLY-04-03 field catalog and contains the data in the state they were in as of the end of the cruise. At that time, the Conductivity Temperature Depth (CTD) and bottle data were in their final form. The state (preliminary or final) of all other data sets on this CD was unknown at that time.

title: GenBank accession numbers for genetic data on D1D2 gene of copepods
Summary: This data set contains the GenBank accession numbers for genetic data gathered on the D1D2 gene of copepods during the Shelf Basin Interactions (SBI) field project. These sequences are now available to everyone who accesses GenBank. The accession number is on the right; our internal number is on the left and the name of the species of copepod is in the middle.

title: UAF Barrow Canyon and Central Channel Moorings
Summary: Two year-long moorings were deployed on the Chukchi Sea shelf (Barrow Canyon and Central Channel) between August 2002 / September 2003 and September 2003 / September 2004. Each mooring was instrumented with an upward looking Acoustic Doppler Current Profiler (ADCP) and T/C recorders.

title: HLY-04-02 Dissolved Inorganic Carbon (DIC) Data [Bates, N. R.]
Summary:
This data set contains Dissolved Inorganic Carbon (DIC) data collected during the SBI spring 2004 cruise of the Chukchi and Beaufort Seas aboard the U.S. Coast Guard Cutter (USCGC) Healy. Data are provided in both Excel file and ASCII file format, with one data file for each file format. 
Note: Data have been updated as of 10 June 2011.

title: HLY-04-03 Dissolved Inorganic Carbon (DIC) Data [Bates, N. R.]
Summary:
This data set contains Dissolved Inorganic Carbon (DIC) data collected during the SBI summer 2004 cruise of the Chukchi and Beaufort Seas aboard the U.S. Coast Guard Cutter (USCGC) Healy. Data are provided in both Excel file and ASCII file format, with one data file for each file format. 
Note: Data have been updated as of 10 June 2011.

title: HLY-04-02 Dissolved Inorganic Carbon (DIC) Data (Excel) [Bates, N. R.]
Summary:
This data set contains Dissolved Inorganic Carbon (DIC) data collected during the SBI spring 2004 cruise of the Chukchi and Beaufort Seas aboard the U.S. Coast Guard Cutter (USCGC) Healy. 
Note: This data set has been superseded as of 10 June 2011. Please see the Related Links below for the link to the superseding dataset.

title: HLY-04-03 Dissolved Inorganic Carbon (DIC) Data (Excel) [Bates, N. R.]
Summary:
This dataset contains Dissolved Inorganic Carbon data collected during the SBI summer 2004 cruise of the Chukchi and Beaufort Seas aboard the USCGC Healy.

Note: This dataset has been superceded as of 10 June 2011.  Please see the Related Links below for the link to the superceding dataset.

title: Effect of a warming climate on Arctic shelf and basin Calanus populations: implications for Pan-Arctic ecosystem dynamics
Summary: This data set comprises modeling results from a project describing potential coupled biological (life history, development rates, food availability) and physical (temperature, advection) processes determining the biogeography of two Arctic copepod Calanus spp. (C. hyperboreus and C. glacialis) and two sub-Arctic copepod Calanus spp. (C. finmarchicus and C. marshallae). Scenarios of warming and a lengthened growth season (dictated by food availability) also are tested. This data set links to a web site describing the project and the model in more detail and providing access to the model output (biological and physical fields) and to a manuscript in press.

title: SBI Cruise HLY0201 merged bottle dataset
Summary: This data set contains merged bottle data from the SBI cruise on the United States Coast Guard Cutter (USCGC) Healy (HLY0201). During this cruise rosette casts were conducted and a bottle data file was generated by the Scripps Service group from these water samples. Additional groups were funded to measure supplementary parameters from these same water samples. This data set is the first version of the merging of the Scripps Service group bottle data file with these data gathered by these additional groups.

title: SBI Cruise HLY0403 merged bottle dataset
Summary: This data set contains merged bottle data from the SBI cruise on the United States Coast Guard Cutter (USCGC) Healy HLY0403. During this cruise rosette casts were conducted and a bottle data file was generated by the Scripps Service group from these water samples. Additional groups were funded to measure supplementary parameters from these same water samples. This data set is the first version of the merging of the Scripps Service group bottle data file with these data gathered by these additional groups.

title: SBI Cruise HLY0402 merged bottle dataset
Summary: This data set contains merged bottle data from the SBI cruise on the United States Coast Guard Cutter (USCGC) Healy (HLY0402). During this cruise rosette casts were conducted and a bottle data file was generated by the Scripps Service group from these water samples. Additional groups were funded to measure supplementary parameters from these same water samples. This data set is the first version of the merging of the Scripps Service group bottle data file with these data gathered by these additional groups.

title: SBI Cruise NBP03-04a merged bottle dataset
Summary: This data set contains merged bottle data from the SBI cruise on the United States Coast Guard Cutter (USCGC) Nathaniel B. Palmer (NBP03-04a). During this cruise rosette casts were conducted and a bottle data file was generated by the Scripps Service group from these water samples. Additional groups were funded to measure supplementary parameters from these same water samples. This data set is the first version of the merging of the Scripps Service group bottle data file with these data gathered by these additional groups.

title: SBI Cruise HLY0203 merged bottle dataset
Summary: This data set contains merged bottle data from the SBI cruise on the United States Coast Guard Cutter (USCGC) Healy (HLY0203). During this cruise rosette casts were conducted and a bottle data file was generated by the Scripps Service group from these water samples. Additional groups were funded to measure supplementary parameters from these same water samples. This data set is the first version of the merging of the Scripps Service group bottle data file with these data gathered by these additional groups.

title: Surface, Operational GTS surface obs from the ship.(DECODED)(ASCII)
Summary: This dataset contains SHEBA surface observations submitted to the GTS. Observations are made every 6 hours. Recorded data include position, temperature, dewpoint, pressure, pressure tendency, cloud base, visibility, current and past weather, winds, and cloud coverage and type.

title: Radarsat Quick Look Imagery
Summary: This is a link to Radarsat Quick-look imagery for SHEBA.

title: Ice Camp Wx Ob/Position/Heading (0300 UTC daily). (ASCII) [Moritz/ARM]
Summary: Daily record of weather observations, GPS position and ship heading at the Ice Station. Data are PRELIMINARY ASCII listing from SPO and ARM systems. The weather observation is made at 0300 UTC daily. Position is read from the ship's bridge and the heading is that of the ship's bow. Period covered from 11/4/97 through present.

title: Tower, 20m flux multi-level msmts (PRELIMINARY) [Andreas, E., C. Fairall, P. Guest, O. Persson]
Summary: This dataset contains preliminary hourly data from the Meteorology Group's 20m tower at the SHEBA ice camp. Data are released as of 18 January, 1998. Data screening has been fairly strict to reject all bad data; thus, some additional data may be recovered with further processing.

title: Tower, PRELIMINARY 10m SPO surface met data. (ASCII) [Moritz, R.]
Summary: This dataset contains preliminary 10-minute data from the SHEBA Project Office 10m tower at the SHEBA ice camp. The PRELIMINARY data that were released cover the period from 09 October to 22 Nov. 1997. Data are from the surface meteorology 10m towerwas located 200 m starboard of the ship (Sfc met 1). Parameters include temperature, dew point, wind direction, and speed all at 2 m and 10 m plus pressure and longwave and shortwave incident radiation.

title: Tower, PRELIMINARY 10m SPO surface met data plots(station1). (GIF) [Moritz, R.]
Summary: This dataset includes preliminary GIF images from the SHEBA Project Office 10m tower at the SHEBA ice camp. The PRELIMINARY data are from the surface meteorology 10m tower located 200 m starboard of the ship (Sfc met 1). Parameters include temperature, dew point, wind direction, and speed all at 2 m and 10 m plus pressure and longwave and shortwave incident radiation. A subset of the data are available for 9 Oct- 22Nov 1997 in ASCII text format. (13.107)

title: Tower, PRELIMINARY 10m SPO surface met data plots(station2). (GIF) [Moritz, R.]
Summary: This dataset contains preliminary GIF images from the SHEBA Project Office 10m towers at the SHEBA ice camp. The PRELIMINARY data are from the surface meteorology 10m tower located 200 m to port of the ship (Sfc_met 2). Parameters include temperature, dew point, wind direction and wind speed all at 2 m and 10 m plus pressure and longwave and shortwave incident radiation.

title: Ice Camp Surface Ship Weather Reports (ASCII) [Moritz, R.]
Summary: This dataset consists of the surface weather reports prepared at six-hour intervals by the SHEBA Project Office and coded according to the "Ship's Synoptic Code". The variables reported include cloud base height, visibility, cloud fraction, wind direction, wind speed, air temperature, dew point temperature, sea-level pressure, pressure tendency, present weather, past weather, amount of low and middle cloud.

title: Tower, 5-level hourly measurements plus radiometer and surface data at Met City (ASFG) [Andreas, E., C. Fairall, P. Guest, O. Persson]
Summary: This dataset contains processed data from the flux group tower at Met City in the SHEBA ice camp. This dataset contains data from all 5 levels on the tower as well as the radiometer and surface measurements (including the Barnes, GE and the two thermistors). The tower data include sensible heat flux and momentum flux as well as the relative humidity (RH), wind speed, and temperature data. This dataset also includes variances, structure functions etc. for each level.

title: Tower, Interpolated hourly measurements to 2.5 and 10m at Met City (ASFG) [Andreas, E., C. Fairall, P. Guest, O. Persson]
Summary: This dataset contains processed data from the flux group tower at Met City in the SHEBA ice camp. This dataset is derived from the 5-level hourly measurements by taking the median fluxes and interpolating the temperature, humidity and wind to 2.5 and 10 m. This dataset does not contain any of the variances, etc, but does contain bulk estimates of latent heat flux and sensible heat flux at 2.5 and 10m.

title: Ice Camp Surface Mesonet NCAR PAM-III, Atlanta site (PRELIMINARY) (GIF) [Andreas, E., et al.]
Summary: This dataset contains data from the NCAR portable automated mesonet (PAM-III) station (Atlanta site). This is one of six stations deployed in the vicinity (within 5 km) of the SHEBA Ice Camp. Other stations are Baltimore, Cleveland, Florida, Seattle and Maui. This station measures pressure, temperature, RH, wind speed and direction, energy budget parameters (4) and energy flux parameters (3). This dataset contains preliminary data. The final datasets are 13.838 and 13.839.

title: Ice Camp Surface Mesonet NCAR PAM-III, Baltimore site (PRELIMINARY)(GIF) [Andreas, E., et al.]
Summary: This dataset contains data from the NCAR portable automated mesonet (PAM-III) station (Baltimore site). This is one of six stations deployed in the vicinity (within 5 km) of the SHEBA Ice Camp. Other stations are Atlanta, Cleveland, Florida, Seattle and Maui. This station measures pressure, temperature, RH, wind speed and direction, energy budget parameters (4) and energy flux parameters (3).This dataset contains preliminary data. The final datasets are 13.838 and 13.839.

title: Ice Camp Surface Mesonet NCAR PAM-III, Cleveland site (PRELIMINARY)(GIF) [Andreas, E., et al.]
Summary: This dataset contains data from the NCAR portable automated mesonet (PAM-III) station (Cleveland site). This is one of six stations deployed in the vicinity (within 5 km) of the SHEBA Ice Camp. Other stations are Atlanta, Baltimore, Florida, Seattle and Maui. This station measures pressure, temperature, RH, wind speed and direction, energy budget parameters (4) and energy flux parameters (3).This dataset contains preliminary data. The final datasets are 13.838 and 13.839.

title: Ice Camp Surface Mesonet NCAR PAM-III, Florida site (PRELIMINARY)(GIF) [Andreas, E., et al.]
Summary: This dataset contains data from the NCAR portable automated mesonet (PAM-III) station (Florida site). This is one of six stations deployed in the vicinity (within 5 km) of the SHEBA Ice Camp. Other stations are Atlanta, Baltimore, Cleveland, Seattle and Maui. This station measures pressure, temperature, RH, wind speed and direction, energy budget parameters (4) and energy flux parameters (3).This dataset contains preliminary data. The final datasets are 13.838 and 13.839.

title: Ice Camp Surface Mesonet NCAR PAM-III, site position/drift.(GIF) [Andreas, E., et al.]
Summary: Four NCAR portable automated mesonet (PAM-III) stations (Atlanta, Baltimore, Cleveland and Florida sites) are deployed  in the vicinity (within 5 km) of the SHEBA Ice Camp.  Station position and drift are plotted as derived from GPS.  Positions every 12 hours are shown in the plot.  Position every 5 minutes is available in the digital record.

title: ETL Radar-Lidar 10-min Cloud Physical Properties [Shupe, M., J. Intrieri, T. Uttal]
Summary: Data set combines radar, lidar, and radiosonde measurements to give a comprehensive view of cloud boundaries, locations, and temperatures for the SHEBA annual cycle. Information includes: best estimated low cloud base and high cloud top, total cloud thickness, total number of cloud layers, the presence and location of liquid in the atmospheric column and temperatures at all relevant heights.

title: ETL Radar-based Cloud Microphysics Retrievals [Shupe, M., and T. Uttal]
Summary: Cloud microphysical properties are derived from retrieval techniques that combine ground-based radar and radiometer measurements from the SHEBA ice camp. Retrieved parameters include: particle size, water content, water path, particle concentration, and optical depth for all-ice, all-liquid, mixed-phase, and precipitating cloud types. The companion radar and radiometer files on which these retrievals are based are also available in the NCAR-EOL data archive.

title: ASFG PAM Surface Temperatures [Andreas, E., C. Fairall, P. Guest, O. Persson]
Summary: This dataset contains surface temperature data from the SHEBA Atmospheric Surface Flux Group (ASFG) sites. This dataset includes data from 4 sites: the main ASFG Tower, the portable automated mesonet (PAM) site in Atlanta, the PAM site in Baltimore, and the PAM site in Florida. The fith ASFG site in SHEBA was another PAM station that moved from Cleveland to Seattle to Maui so there is no long uninterrupted record as exists for the other 4 sites, hence data from the 5th station is not included here.

title: Model Ice Deformation and Ice Thickness Distribution [Lindsay, R.]
Summary: This data set consists of daily estimates of the ice velocity, deformation, mean thickness, the thickness distribution, thermal forcings, and the energy balance of the ice near SHEBA. The data sources and methods are described in two accompanying papers to be published in the Journal of Geophysical Research (in the files sheba_ice_deformation_paper.pdf and sheba_ice_thickness_paper.pdf).

title: Depolarization and Backscatter Unattended Lidar dataset (10 Second Averages) [Intrieri, J. and B. McCarty]
Summary: The Depolarization and Backscatter - Unattended Lidar (DABUL) is a pulsed laser-radar operating at 523 nm wavelength.  Range resolution is 30 m, and time resolution is as short as 1 s.  This dataset contains two final products: Lidar returned-power netcdf data files, and Linear depolarization ratio netcdf data files.  All of the final products have been averaged for 10 seconds.

title: SHEBA/JOIS Bottle Cast Oxygen Data [Sherr, E. and B. Sherr]
Summary: This data set represents dissolved oxygen (DO) concentrations and oxygen saturation values for discrete water samples collected during bottle casts down to 50 m, 120 m or 240 m during the SHEBA drift experiment. This data set consists of an Excel workbook with three worksheets.

title: Soundings, PRELIM Ice Camp NCAR/GLAS SkewT Plots. (jpg) [Moritz, R.]
Summary: A GPS sounding system is deployed at the ice camp by NCAR/SSSF. Soundings are taken every 12 hours throughout the 13 month deployment period. PRELIMINARY JPEG plots are provided for each launch time at 0000 and 1200 UTC daily. One Second ASCII data listings are also available. (13.202)

title: Soundings, PRELIM Ice Camp NCAR/GLAS raobs. (ASCII) [Moritz, R.]
Summary: A GPS sounding system is deployed at the ice camp by NCAR/SSSF. Soundings are taken every 12 hours throughout the 13 month deployment period. PRELIMINARY one-second time resolution ASCII data are provided for each launch time at 0000 and 1200 UTC daily. JPEG skew-t plots are also available. (13.201)

title: Soundings, PRELIM Ice Camp UAF tethered balloon. (GIF)(UAF) [Storvold, R.]
Summary: This dataset contains data from a tethered balloon system deployed by the U. of Alaska, Fairbanks at the ice station. Soundings are taken on selected days throughout the 13 month deployment period. PRELIMINARY GIF images are provided for parameters versus time and versus altitude. Parameters include wind speed, direction, relative humidty (RH) temperature and pressure.

title: Soundings, Ice Camp UAF tethered balloon Data (ASCII)(UAF) [Storvold, R.]
Summary: A tethered balloon system was deployed by the U. of Alaska, Fairbanks at the ice station. Soundings are taken on selected days throughout the 13 month deployment period. Companion datasets containing PRELIMINARY GIF images of sounding data as well as radiometric data files are also present in this archive.

title: Soundings, Ice Camp UAF radiometric tethered balloon data (ASCII)(UAF) [Storvold, R.]
Summary: A tethered balloon system was deployed by the U. of Alaska, Fairbanks at the ice station. Soundings were taken on selected days throughout the 13 month deployment period. This dataset contains radiometer data from a cube-like sensor suspended approximately 30m below the balloon which measured hemispherical radiation in all directions. Unfortunately, due to a cable problem only 4 data files from the campaign contained good data. Most of the data files contain one ascending and one descending profile. These data was obtained between 9/14/98 and 9/21/98.

title: NOAA ETL LIDAR DABUL System FINAL 10-min Avg Depol Ratio (GIF) [Intrieri, J.]
Summary: NOAA ETL deployed the Depolarization and Backscatter - Unattended LIDAR (DABUL) aboard the SHEBA ship. Images are FINAL 10-minute averaged depolarization ratio intensity (1 image per day) for most of the SHEBA Field Project.

title: NOAA ETL LIDAR DABUL System FINAL 10-min Avg Far-parallel Channel Intensity (GIF) [Intrieri, J.]
Summary: NOAA ETL deployed the Depolarization and Backscatter - Unattended LIDAR (DABUL) aboard the SHEBA ship. Images are FINAL 10-minute averaged far-parallel channel intensity (1 image per day) for most of the SHEBA Field Project. These images are in GIF format.

title: NOAA ETL LIDAR DABUL System Preliminary Unaveraged Cloud Parameters (GIF) [Intrieri, J.]
Summary: NOAA ETL deployed Depolarization and Backscatter - Unattended LIDAR (DABUL) aboard the SHEBA ship. Images are PRELIMINARY unaveraged cloud base, height and top for subset of data intercomparison period 9-10 Nov, 1997. These images are in GIF format. ASCII formattted digital data for this time period are also available in this archive.

title: NOAA ETL LIDAR DABUL System Preliminary Unaveraged Cloud Parameters (ASCII) [Intrieri, J.]
Summary: NOAA ETL deployed Depolarization and Backscatter - Unattended LIDAR (DABUL) aboard the SHEBA ship. ASCII data are PRELIMINARY unaveraged cloud base, height and top for subset of data intercomparison period 9-10 Nov, 1997. These data are in ASCII format. GIF images for this time period are also available in this archive.

title: NOAA ETL LIDAR DABUL System Preliminary Depolar Ratio 1-21 Nov.(ASCII) [Intrieri, J.]
Summary: NOAA ETL deployed Depolarization and Backscatter - Unattended LIDAR (DABUL) aboard the SHEBA ship. ASCII data are PRELIMINARY depolarization ratio data for the data intercomparison period 1-21 Nov, 1997. These data are in ASCII format. GIF images for this parameter during this timer period are also available in this data archive.

title: NOAA ETL LIDAR DABUL System PRELIM Far-Parallel Channel Intensity (ASCII) [Intrieri, J.]
Summary: NOAA ETL deployed Depolarization and Backscatter - Unattended LIDAR (DABUL) aboard the SHEBA ship. ASCII data are PRELIMINARY far-parallel channel intensity for the data intercomparison period 1-21 Nov, 1997.These data are in ASCII format. GIF images for this parameter during this period period are also available in this archive.

title: NOAA ETL LIDAR DABUL System 5-min Preliminary Cloud Base, Tops, Height (ASCII) [Intrieri, J.]
Summary: NOAA ETL deployed DABUL LIDAR aboard the SHEBA ship. These ASCII data are PRELIMINARY 5-min averaged cloud base, top, and height data for the data intercomparison period 1-21 Nov, 1997. GIF images for this parameter during this period period are also available in this archive.

title: NOAA ETL LIDAR DABUL System 5-min Preliminary Cloud Base, Tops, Height (GIF) [Intrieri, J.]
Summary: NOAA ETL deployed DABUL LIDAR aboard the SHEBA ship. These GIF data are PRELIMINARY 5-min averaged cloud base, top, and height data for the data intercomparison period 1-21 Nov, 1997. ASCII data for these parameters during this period are also available in this archive.

title: NOAA ETL LIDAR DABUL System Quick-look PRELIMINARY Ice Camp Images (GIF) [Intrieri, J.]
Summary: NOAA ETL deployed DABUL LIDAR aboard the SHEBA ship. These GIF images are PRELIMINARY from the ice camp for the entire deployment period. Each image covers a 24 hour period. More detailed ASCII data and plots are available as processing is completed.

title: Radar, ETL vertically pointing; Final 12-hr Radar Reflectivity Images (GIF) [Uttal, T.]
Summary: NOAA ETL deployed a vertically pointing Doppler radar aboard the SHEBA ship. GIF images are FINAL from the ice camp for entire deployment period. Each image covers a 12 hour period. Data are available in netCDF format in a companion dataset.

title: Radar, ETL vertically pointing; Final 12-hr Radar Velocity Images (GIF) [Uttal, T.]
Summary: NOAA ETL deployed a vertically pointing Doppler radar aboard the SHEBA ship. GIF images are FINAL from the ice camp for entire deployment period. Each image covers a 12 hour period. Data are available in netCDF format in a companion dataset.

title: Radar, ETL vertically pointing; Final 12-hr Merged Radar Data (netCDF) [Uttal, T.]
Summary: NOAA ETL deployed a vertically pointing Doppler radar aboard the SHEBA ship.  This dataset contains final, corrected and merged 12 hour radar netCDF files for the entire deployment period. Files contain reflectivity, Doppler velocity, spectral width, mode id, and signal-to-noise ratio data.

title: Radar, ETL vertically pointing; Final Cloud Boundaries (netCDF) [Uttal, T.]
Summary: NOAA ETL deployed a vertically pointing Doppler radar aboard the SHEBA ship. This dataset contains final radar cloud boundary netCDF files for the entire deployment period.

title: Radar, ETL vertically pointing; Final Cloud Boundaries (ASCII) [Uttal, T.]
Summary: NOAA ETL deployed a vertically pointing Doppler radar aboard the SHEBA ship. This dataset contains final 12 hr cloud boundary ASCII files for the entire deployment period.

title: NOAA ETL LIDAR DABUL System 10-min Average Cloud Base, Top Heights, Depol ratio (ASCII) [Uttal, T.]
Summary: NOAA ETL deployed the Depolarization and Backscatter - Unattended Lidar (DABUL) LIDAR aboard the SHEBA ship. This data set contains final 10 minute cloud property and aerosol ASCII data files for the entire deployment period.

title: Ice Camp Scintillometer Data [Andreas, E., C. Fairall, P. Guest, O. Persson]
Summary: These data were collected with a Scintec (Tubingen, Germany) Surface-Layer Scintillometer System. The main variables reported are hourly averages of the refractive index structure parameter Cn2 (C, sub-n, squared) and the inner scale of turbulence el-0 (el, sub-zero).

title: Satellite NOAA polar orbiter IR Composite Image.(GIF) [Univ. Of Alaska, Geophysical Institute]
Summary: This data set contains infrared IR composite image from the NOAA polar orbiter AVHRR data. Images were produced every 2 hours from the University of Alaska Geophysical Institute.

title: Satellite NOAA-12, band 3 imagery (GIF) [Univ. Of Alaska, Geophysical Institute]
Summary: This data set contains NOAA-12 band 3 images from the University of Alaska, Geophysical Institue. Two passes per day resulted in two images per day between approximately 1600 and 1900 UTC. These images are in GIF format.

title: Satellite NOAA-12, band 4 imagery(GIF) [Univ. Of Alaska, Geophysical Institute]
Summary: This data set contains NOAA-12 band 4 images from the University of Alaska, Geophysical Institute. Two passes per day resulted in two images per day taken between approximately 1600 and 1900 UTC. These images are in GIF format.

title: Satellite NOAA-14 11micron channel images (GIF) [Univ. of Wisconsin, SSEC]
Summary: This data set contains NOAA-14 11-micron band images (GIF) provided by SSEC at the University of Wisconsin. Images were available at 2200 UTC for all periods and at 1400 UTC September through November 1997. Images also have latitude and longitude and ice camp position as overlays.

title: Satellite NOAA-14 3.7micron channel images (GIF) [Univ. of Wisconsin, SSEC]
Summary: This data set contains NOAA-14 3.7-micron band images (GIF) provided by SSEC at the University of Wisconsin. Images are available at 2200 UTC. Images also have latitude and longitude and ice camp position as overlays.

title: Satellite NOAA-14 1km hi res IR images (GIF) [Univ. of Wisconsin, SSEC]
Summary: This data set contains NOAA-14 1km high resolution IR images (GIF) provided by SSEC at the University of Wisconsin. Images are available at 2200 UTC for all periods and at 1400 UTC September through November 1997. Images also have latitude and longitude and ice camp position as overlays.

title: Satellite NOAA-12/14, 1km Ice Camp HRPT overpass catalog.(ASCII) [Univ. of Wisconsin, SSEC]
Summary: This data set contains the NOAA-12/14 1km high resolution overpass catalog from the TeraScan satellite ground station operated aboard the SHEBA ship. The listing will cover the entire deployment phase beginning 15 Oct, 1997. The ASCII listing provides date and time and file size for all passes within view of the SHEBA receiver. Data are held off-line in TeraScan TDF format and are available on 8-mm tape.

title: Satellite NOAA-14 VIS images (GIF) [Univ. of Wisconsin, SSEC]
Summary: This data set contains NOAA-14 VIS images (GIF) provided by SSEC at the University of Wisconsin. Images are available at 2200 UTC beginning on 3/9/98. Image resolution is 5 km.

title: Satellite NOAA-12 11micron channel images (GIF) [Univ. of Wisconsin, SSEC]
Summary: This data set contains NOAA-12 11-micron band images (GIF) provided by SSEC at the University of Wisconsin. Images are available at 0400 UTC and at 1900 UTC. Images also have latitude and longitude and ice camp position as overlays.

title: Satellite NOAA-12/14 1km hi res VIS images (GIF) [Univ. of Wisconsin, SSEC]
Summary: This data set contains NOAA-12/14 1km high resolution VIS images (GIF) provided by SSEC at the University of Wisconsin. Images also have latitude and longitude and ice camp position as overlays.

title: Satellite NOAA 12/14, NSA AVHRR Data (Link to ARM) [ARM]
Summary: Measurements from the Advanced Very High Resolution Radiometer (AVHRR) on the NOAA polar orbiting satellites taken over the North Slope of Alaska (NSA)/SHEBA region during the SHEBA project are available for distribution to the ARM community.

title: Satellite RGPS Ice Motion Products (Link to NASA-JPL) [NASA/JPL]
Summary: The Eulerian Ice Motion Products were produced by tracking common features on a 200km-by-200km grid centered at the SHEBA Ice Camp. The data source is the RADARSAT Satellite.

title: Satellite NOAA/NASA Polar Pathfinder SHEBA grids (Link to NSIDC) [NSIDC]
Summary: The data provided are subsets of the Advanced Very High Resolution Radiometer (AVHRR) Polar Pathfinder (APP) 5km dataset. Please see the on-line documentation of the APP products available on the National Snow and Ice Data Center (NSIDC) web site for full descriptions of the APP products.Using the daily position of the Des Groseillers, a 21x21 pixel region centered on the ship location was extracted from the standard twice-daily APP grids for all products excluding ice motion and the surface type mask. These twice-daily subsets were then combined into individual flat-binary data files organized as arrays dimensioned as (21,21,ndays), where ndays equals the number of days available in the APP time series. One such array was generated for each APP product except ice motion, surface type mask, and orbit mask.

title: Satellite SAR floe size (ASCII) [Holt, B.]
Summary: This dataset contains data floe size distributions obtained from spaceborne Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) imagery. Floe sizes were derived using an algorithm referenced in 1) Soh, L.-K., B. Holt, and C. Tsatsoulis: Identifying ice floes and computing ice floe distributions in Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) images, in Analysis of Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) data of the polar regions, C. Tsatsoulis and R. Kwok (eds.), Springer-Verlag, New York, 9-34, 1998.

title: Satellite SAR floe size (GIF) [Holt, B.]
Summary: This dataset contains data floe size distributions obtained from spaceborne Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) imagery. Floe sizes were derived using an algorithm referenced in 1) Soh, L.-K., B. Holt, and C. Tsatsoulis: Identifying ice floes and computing ice floe distributions in Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) images, in Analysis of Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) data of the polar regions, C. Tsatsoulis and R. Kwok (eds.), Springer-Verlag, New York, 9-34, 1998.

title: Satellite RADARSAT SAR Imagery [Stern, H.]
Summary: This dataset is a link to web pages found at the University of Washington Polar Science Center. These pages are maintained by Harry Stern and Dick Moritz and contain metadata, imagery and derived products pertaining to RADARSAT data collected during the SHEBA field project. To see these pages, click on Link to Remote Data Archive above.

title: Satellite RADARSAT SAR Sea Ice Motion [Stern, H.]
Summary: This data set is a link to web pages found at the University of Washington Polar Science Center. These pages are maintained by Harry Stern and Dick Moritz and contain metadata, imagery and derived products pertaining to RADARSAT data collected during the SHEBA field project.

title: Satellite RADARSAT SAR Sea Ice Deformation [Stern, H.]
Summary: This dataset is a link to web pages found at the University of Washington Polar Science Center. These pages are maintained by Harry Stern and Dick Moritz and contain metadata, imagery and derived products pertaining to RADARSAT data collected during the SHEBA field project.

title: Arctic Nutrient Database 1997-1998 [Cota, G., T. Siferd, and L. Pomeroy]
Summary: During SHEBA, water salinity, PO4, SiO3, NO2, NO3, and NH4 content were measured at various SHEBA stations.  For more information, please see the readme file.  This dataset is in Microsoft Access 2000 format.

title: Sea Ice Analysis Beaufort Sea (GIF) [National Ice Center]
Summary: This data set contains Sea Ice analysis for the Beaufort Sea north of Alaska. Data are provided by the National Ice Center based on satellite and surface reports. Maps are provided once per day at 1200 UTC but updated only every 7-14 days.

title: Sea Ice Analysis Chukchi Sea (GIF) [National Ice Center]
Summary: This data set contains Sea Ice analysis for the Chukchi Sea west of Alaska. Data are provided by the National Ice Center based on satellite and surface reports. Maps are provided once per day at 1200 UTC but are updated only every 10-14 days.

title: Ice Camp Position/Velocity(FINAL) (ASCII) [Moritz, R.]
Summary: This dataset contains both "raw" and interpolated ship position and velocity measurements from the Des Groseillers during the SHEBA project. The logbooks of the Des Groseillers for the period of the SHEBA Field Experiment were photocopied by the Canadian Coast Guard and provided to the SHEBA Project Office. The date, time, GPS position and Gyro heading were entered into a computer file at the SPO. These raw data were plotted for inspection and compared with other datasets including the SPO observer logbooks, and Miles McPhee's GPS time series for the Ocean City. Based on these plots and comparisons, obvious errors of logbook entries were identified and corrected where possible. The position data were interpolated using a cubic spline to estimate the position and velocity components at hourly intervals. The spline passes through the corrected raw positions in a five-day window centered on each hourly interpolation time. Upon ordering, the user will receive both the raw data file and the interpolated data.

title: Ice Camp (PRELIMINARY) position/heading (hourly). (ASCII) [McPhee, M.]
Summary: Hourly record of GPS drift velocities and position from the Ice Station. Data are smoothed through a complex filter. Period covered from 10/14/1997 through 09/25/1998 with a few gaps.

title: Ice Camp (PRELIMINARY) drift. (GIF) [ARM]
Summary: This data set contains the six hourly record of GPS position and heading from the Ice Station. Data are retrieved from the ARM GPS system and should be considered PRELIMINARY. Period covered from 10/17/97 through the present. The record is updated weekly.

title: Ice Camp (PRELIMINARY) AERI data. (GIF) [ARM]
Summary: This data set contains PRELIMINARY data from the ARM Atmospheric Emitted Radiance Interferometer (AERI). Data are GIF images of temperature plots from selected days.

title: Ice Camp (PRELIMINARY) AERI channel-1 data. (GIF) [ARM]
Summary: This data set contains PRELIMINARY data from channel-1 of the ARM Atmospheric Emitted Radiance Interferometer (AERI). Data are GIF images of temperature plots from selected days.

title: Ice Camp (PRELIMINARY) AERI channel-2 data. (GIF) [ARM]
Summary: This data set contains PRELIMINARY data from channel-2 of the ARM Atmospheric Emitted Radiance Interferometer (AERI). Data are GIF images of temperature plots from selected days.

title: Ice Camp (PRELIMINARY) CTD cast data. (ASCII) (PSC) [McPhee, M.]
Summary: This data set contains PRELIMINARY data from conductivity, temperature and depth (CTD) casts taken at the Ice Station. Parameters include pressure, temperature, conductivity and salinity. Data are ASCII text of CTD casts from selected days.

title: Ice Camp (PRELIMINARY) CTD Yoyo Cast Data. (GIF) (PSC) [McPhee, M.]
Summary: This data set contains PRELIMINARY data from conductivity, temperature and depth (CTD) casts taken at the Ice Station. Parameters include pressure, temperature, conductivity and salinity and may be multiple ascents and/or descents (yoyo) casts. Data are ASCII text of CTD casts from selected days.

title: Ice Camp (PRELIMINARY) Snow Depth (ASCII) (CRREL) [Perovich]
Summary: This data set contains PRELIMINARY snow depth data from CRREL main line Baltimore-Seattle and Baltimore line. Main line is 500 m long and observations are made every 5 meters on selected days throughout the deployment. Data are ASCII text of mean, median and standard deviation in cm.

title: Ice Camp (PRELIMINARY) Ice Thickness (ASCII) (CRREL) [Perovich]
Summary: This data set contains PRELIMINARY ice thickness data from CRREL ice thicknes gages at Baltimore, Pittsburgh and Seattle sites. Measurements are made from multiple gages at each site on selected days throughout the deployment. Data are ASCII text of ice thickness in cm.

title: Ice Camp (PRELIMINARY) Ice Core Temperatures for Baltimore site (ASCII) (CRREL) [Perovich]
Summary: This data set contains PRELIMINARY ice core temperature cross-section data from CRREL ice thermistor chains at Baltimore site. Measurements are made hourly from each site on throughout the deployment. Data are ASCII text of ice temperature in degrees centigrade to nearest .1 degree. Measurement increment is 10 cm through the ice column and into the upper ocean a total of 230 cm from the upper ice surface.

title: Ice Camp (PRELIMINARY) Ice Core Temperatures for Seattle site. (ASCII) (CRREL) [Perovich]
Summary: This data set contains PRELIMINARY ice core temperature cross-section data from CRREL ice thermistor chains at Seattle site. Measurements are made hourly from each site on throughout the deployment. Data are ASCII text of ice temperature in degrees centigrade to nearest .1 degree. Measurement increment is 10 cm through the ice column and into the upper ocean a total of 230 cm from the upper ice surface.

title: Ice Camp (PRELIMINARY) ice core temperature msmts, Pittsburgh site. (ASCII) (CRREL) [Perovich]
Summary: This data set contains PRELIMINARY ice core temperature cross-section data from CRREL ice thermistor chains at Pittsburgh site. Measurements are made hourly from each site on throughout the deployment. Data are ASCII text of ice temperature in degrees centigrade to nearest .1 degree. Measurement increment is 10 cm through the ice column and into the upper ocean a total of 230 cm from the upper ice surface.

title: Ice Camp PRELIMINARY SeaCat CTD Cast Imagery (GIF) (PSC) [McPhee, M.]
Summary: This data set contains PRELIMINARY data from conductivity, temperature and depth (CTD) casts taken at the Ice Station. Parameters include temperature and salinity. This data set contains GIF images of CTD casts from selected days.

title: Buoy, IOEB Air, Ice and Biogeochemical Data [Krishfield, R.]
Summary: As part of the SHEBA buoy array, a Japan Marine Science and Technology Center (JAMSTEC) Ice-Ocean Environmental Buoy (IOEB) was deployed on September 30, 1997 from the Des Groseilliers at 75 degrees 5.4 min North, 140 degrees 54.7 min West enroute to installation of the ice camp. Complete year-long time-series of buoy drift, air temperature, barometer, and compass heading were telemetered via Argos during the drift. Partial-year records of wind (< 1/2 year) and ice thermistor profiles (~3/4 year) were also acquired.

title: Ice Camp Summer Leads Data(Final)(ASCII) [Paulson, C.]
Summary: This dataset contains processed data from the SBE-19 Conductivity, Temperature, and Depth (CTD) used to make surface measurements as part of the summer leads portion of SHEBA. In addition, this dataset contains data from 2 Garmin 12XL GPS units. In the field one GPS unit was left on the ice as a reference point while the other was mounted on the port edge of the skiff for determinig the position of the boat. Almost all of these data were collected in a lead ~1km WNW of the ship. Please NOTE: All times and dates reported in the dataset are Local not UTC.

title: Ice Camp Summer Leads Albedo Data(PRELIMINARY)(ASCII) [Paulson, C.]
Summary: This dataset contains data related to the Epply radiometers used to make surface measurements as part of the summer leads portion of SHEBA. Further information and pictures of the equipment are available at photon.oce.orst.edu/ocean/projects/sheba/sheba.htm . All of the data were collected from a small lead about 1 km WNW from the ship.

title: Buoy, IOEB Doppler Current Profiler (ADCP) Data [Krishfield, R.]
Summary: A 150-kHz narrowband RD Instruments Acoustic Doppler Current Profiler (ADCP) internally recorded 34,805 current ensembles in 362 days from an Ice-Ocean Buoy (IOEB) deployed during the SHEBA project. The IOEB was initially deployed about 50 km from the main camp and drifted from 75.1 N, 141 W to 80.6 N, 160 W between October 1, 1997 and September 30, 1998. The ADCP was located at a depth of 14m below the ice surface and was configured to record data at 15 minute intervals from 40 8m wide bins extending downward 320m below the instrument. The retrieved 24 Mb raw data are processed to remove noise, correct for platform drift and geomagnetic declination, remove bottom hits, and output 2-hr average Earth-referenced current profiles along with ancillary data.

title: Ice Camp Summer Leads Inherent Optical Properties (ASCII) [Pegau, W. S.]
Summary: This dataset contains data collected from a small lead about 1 km WNW of the SHEBA ship. The data were collected by a SeaBird SBE-25 Conductivity Temperature Depth (CTD) sensor, and an AC-9 instrument. The SBE-25 was used to make physical measurements of the uppermost 60 m of the water column. The AC-9 measured the beam attenuation and absorption coefficients relative to a pure water blank.

title: Ice Camp Summer Leads Profile SBE-19 (ASCII) [Pegau, W. S.]
Summary: This data set contains data collected from a small lead about 1 km WNW of the SHEBA ship by 2 Garmin 12XL GPS units and a SBE-19 Conductivity Temperature Depth (CTD). One Garmin 12xl gps was left on the ice to provide a reference point. The second unit was placed on the port edge of the skiff for determining the position of the boat. The SeaBird SBE-19 Conductivity Temperature Pressure (CTD) sensor was used to make physical measurements of the uppermost 5 to 15 m of the water column.

title: Ice Camp Summer Leads Profile SBE-25 (ASCII) [Pegau, W. S.]
Summary: This data set contains data collected from a small lead about 1 km WNW of the SHEBA ship by 2 Garmin 12XL GPS units and a SBE-25 Conductivity Temperature Depth (CTD). One Garmin 12xl gps was left on the ice to provide a reference point. The second unit was placed on the port edge of the skiff for determining the position of the boat. The SeaBird SBE-25 Conductivity Temperature Pressure (CTD) sensor was used to make physical measurements of the uppermost 60 m of the water column.

title: Ice Camp Ocean Seacat CTD Data-Deep (Preliminary) [Anderson, R. and J. Morison]
Summary: This dataset contains Seacat files for the so-called 'Deep' casts during SHEBA. These data are preliminary in that they are simply the ASCII output from the DATCNV step of SEASOFT. They also use only the pre-SHEBA calibrations. There are 2 data files per cast, one is the .HDR file which is a SEASOFT header, the other is the ASCII data file itself. Most casts contain data from both the down and the uptrace. However, quite a few are downcast only and in some cases the down and upcast are seperate files.

title: Ice Camp Thermal Microstructure and CTD Profiles [Stanton, T.]
Summary: These data are daily averaged 1 m binned profiles of thermal microstructure dissipation rate, chi, and the corresponding temperature, salinity and potential density to a depth of 150 m. These data were measured by an automated profiling winch equipped with a dual sensor SeaBird 911+CTD, and a dual microthermistor thermal dissipation package made by Stanton at the base of the package. The winch and the automated data acquisition system were located about 1 km from the Des Groseillers support ship.

title: Ice Camp Sea Ice Biology (ASCII) [Melnikov, I.]
Summary: These data contain year round observations of the sea ice structure that were organized in the region of the SHEBA ice camp drift.  Changes in the physical, chemical and biological properties of the sea ice cover during the winter and summer were recorded. The goal of this project was to demonstrate the cross-sectional and longitudinal distribution of salinity, temperature, biogeochemical components, chlorophyll and species number within the thickness of multi-year and first year ice in the Beaufort Sea where the SHEBA ice camp was drifted during a period of 1997-1998.

title: Ice Camp CTD Time Series (ASCII) [Stanton, T.]
Summary: These data represent 1m vertically binned values of temperature and salinity for each downcast of the Conductivity, Temperature, Depth (CTD) profiler. This time series was measured during the SHEBA ice station field program by co-PI's Stanton, Martinson, Morison and McPhee. An automated CTD winch repeatedly lowered a dual sensor Sea Bird 911+ CTD from the ice depth to 150m with approximately a 10 minute cycle time. The data are in ASCII format.

title: Ice Camp CTD Time Series (Matlab) [Stanton, T.]
Summary: These data represent 1m vertically binned values of temperature and salinity for each downcast of the Conductivity, Temperature, Depth (CTD) profiler. This time series was measured during the SHEBA ice station field program by co-PI's Stanton, Martinson, Morison and McPhee. An automated CTD winch repeatedly lowered a dual sensor Sea Bird 911+ CTD from the ice depth to 150m with approximately a 10 minute cycle time. The data are in Matlab format.

title: Model - Lower Column Forcing Data (MatLab) [McPhee, M.]
Summary: This dataset was developed as a means of identifying particular events during the SHEBA drift, and assembling in one place data necessary for driving and verifying ice ocean models. It does not include cloud or precipitation data. It does include data of the following types: meteorological, ice, sheba_gpsdata, turb_mast, profiler, ADP and bathymetry. Please see the Readme for more information.

title: Aircraft UW Convair 580 Data Summaries and documentation (Link to UW/CARG) [UW/CARG]
Summary: A report entitled: Summary of Flights and Types of Data Collected on the University of Washington's (UW) Convair-580 Aircraft in the FIRE-ACE/SHEBA Project in the Arctic from 19 May through 24 June 1998 is referenced through this link. This report contains the following sections: 1) Objectives of the UW Convair 580 Flights in FIRE-ACE/SHEBA, 2) Instrumentation aboard the UW Convair 580 for FIRE-ACE/SHEBA, 3) Types of data collected aboard the Convair 580 in FIRE-ACE/SHEBA, 4) Convair 580 flights and flight tracks in FIRE-ACE/SHEBA, 5) In-Flight summaries for each Convair 580 flight in FIRE-ACE/SHEBA. The following are a listing of Convair 580 Flight Date/Times (Note: all times are approximate and are UTC): Flight 1750: 5/19 2106 - 0053 5/20 Flight 1751: 5/20 1947 - 2351 5/20 Flight 1752: 5/21 2005 - 2255 5/21 Flight 1753: 5/23 1904 - 2053 5/23 Flight 1754: 5/27 2238 - 0307 5/28 Flight 1755: 5/28 2000 - 2316 5/28 Flight 1756: 5/29 1919 - 0124 5/30 Flight 1757: 5/30 1906 - 0026 5/31 Flight 1758: 6/01 2000 - 0105 6/02 Flight 1759: 6/02 1959 - 2317 6/02 Flight 1760: 6/03 1906 - 0039 6/04 Flight 1761: 6/05 2146 - 0128 6/06 Flight 1762: 6/06 1932 - 2319 6/06 Flight 1763: 6/07 1904 - 0135 6/08 Flight 1764: 6/09 1859 - 2250 6/09 Flight 1765: 6/11 1801 - 2102 6/11 Flight 1766: 6/13 1746 - 2259 6/13 Flight 1767: 6/14 1912 - 2218 6/14 Flight 1768: 6/18 1856 - 0014 6/19 Flight 1769: 6/19 2051 - 0050 6/20 Flight 1770: 6/22 1800 - 2327 6/22 Flight 1771: 6/23 2120 - 0209 6/24 Flight 1772: 6/24 2014 - 2310 6/24.

title: Aircraft Twin Otter Surface-Properties Surveys [SHEBA Project Office]
Summary: This data set consists of measurements of the surface temperature of the ice obtained from the Twin Otter logistics aircraft during the SHEBA field project.

title: Aircraft Twin Otter Surface-Properties Surveys (Video Tape) [SHEBA Project Office]
Summary: This data set consists of video tapes of the surface obtained from the Twin Otter logistics aircraft during the SHEBA field project.

title: Satellite NOAA 12 IR, sfc temps,winds, 500mb heights (GIF) [Wiley, D.]
Summary: This data set contains NOAA 12 IR satellite pass at 0000 UTC daily. Overlay of surface winds and temperature analysis and 500mb heights for the SHEBA domain from SSEC at U. of Wisconsin are included.

title: Model Monthly Net Freezing Rate [Steele, M.]
Summary: This dataset contains computed monthly net freezing rate (nfr) over the entire Arctic Ocean, Barents Sea, and Greenland-Iceland-Norwegian Seas for the years 1997 and 1998. The data have been generated using a numerical sea ice - ocean model described by Zhang et. al.1998. Forcing was provided by the National Centers for Environmental Prediction/National Center for Atmospheric Research (NCEP/NCAR) reanalysis. Net freezing rate is defined as the net growth minus melt over all ice thickness categories, where positive values represent net growth. The data are provided as unformatted binary files and are arranged on a cartesian (x,y) grid based on a polar stereographic projection.

title: Buoy, ARGOS Position Data (ASCII) [Overland, J. E.]
Summary: This dataset contains files which list position and atmospheric conditions at ARGOS drifters located around the SHEBA ship. All files are processed files which have been de-spiked and compared to other buoys' files to eliminate unreasonable values. For more information please see the readme file.

title: Model ECMWF Column Output (ASCII) [Bretherton, C.]
Summary: This dataset contains column model output from the ECMWF for a chosen model gridpoint nearest the location of the SHEBA Ice Camp. This dataset contains four files per day of model output parameters which are divided into main variables, flux parameters, tendencies, and surface variables. This dataset is the february 2000 version which is improved over the original version because large position errors have been removed and the same forecast model version has been used (13R4) to produce the equivalent of a reanalysis.

title: Ice Camp Surface Mesonet NCAR PAM-III, Atlanta site (PRELIMINARY)(ASCII) [Andreas, E., et al.]
Summary: This data set contains NCAR portable automated mesonet (PAM-III) station (Atlanta site). This is one of six stations deployed in the vicinity (within 5 km) of the SHEBA Ice Camp. Other stations are Baltimore, Cleveland, Florida, Maui and Seattle. Station measures pressure, temperature, relative humidity (RH), wind speed and direction, energy budget parameters (4) and energy flux parameters (3). This dataset contains ascii listings of measured data and is preliminary data. The final datasets are 13.838 and 13.839.

title: Ice Camp Surface Mesonet NCAR PAM-III, Baltimore site (PRELIMINARY)(ASCII) [Andreas, E., et al.]
Summary: This data set contains NCAR portable automated mesonet (PAM-III) station (Baltimore site). This is one of six stations deployed in the vicinity (within 5 km) of the SHEBA Ice Camp. Other stations are Atlanta, Cleveland, Florida, Maui and Seattle. Station measures pressure, temperature, RH, wind speed and direction, energy budget parameters (4) and energy flux parameters (3). This data set contains ASCII listings of measured data and is preliminary data. The final data sets are 13.838 and 13.839.

title: Ice Camp Surface Mesonet NCAR PAM-III, Cleveland site (PRELIMINARY)(ASCII) [Andreas, E., et al.]
Summary: This data set contains NCAR portable automated mesonet (PAM-III) station (Cleveland site). This is one of six stations deployed in the vicinity (within 5 km) of the SHEBA Ice Camp. Other stations are Atlanta, Baltimore, Florida, Maui and Seattle. Station measures pressure, temperature, RH, wind speed and direction, energy budget parameters (4) and energy flux parameters (3). This dataset contains ASCII listings of measured data and is preliminary data. The final datasets are 13.838 and 13.839.

title: Ice Camp Surface Mesonet NCAR PAM-III, Florida site (PRELIMINARY)(ASCII) [Andreas, E., et al.]
Summary: This data set contains NCAR portable automated mesonet (PAM-III) station (Florida site). This is one of six stations deployed in the vicinity (within 5 km) of the SHEBA Ice Camp. Other stations are Atlanta, Baltimore, Cleveland, Maui and Seattle. This station measures pressure, temperature, relative humidity (RH), wind speed, wind direction, energy budget parameters (4) and energy flux parameters (3). This dataset contains ASCII listings of measured data and is preliminary data. The final datasets are 13.838 and 13.839.

title: Ice Camp Surface Mesonet NCAR PAM-III, Seattle site (PRELIMINARY)(GIF) [Andreas, E., et al.]
Summary: NCAR portable automated mesonet (PAM-III) station (Seattle site). One of six stations deployed in the vicinity (within 5 km) of the SHEBA Ice Camp. Other stations are Atlanta, Baltimore, Cleveland, Florida, and Maui. Station measures pressure, temperature, relative humdity (RH), wind speed and direction, energy budget parameters (4) and energy flux parameters (3). This dataset contains preliminary data. The final data sets are 13.838 and 13.839.

title: Ice Camp Surface Mesonet NCAR PAM-III, Maui site (PRELIMINARY)(GIF) [Andreas, E., et al.]
Summary: NCAR portable automated mesonet (PAM-III) station (Maui site). One of six stations deployed in the vicinity (within 5 km) of the SHEBA Ice Camp. Other stations are Atlanta, Baltimore, Cleveland, Florida, and Seattle. Station measures pressure, temperature, relative humdity (RH), wind speed and wind direction, energy budget parameters (4) and energy flux parameters (3). This data set contains preliminary data. The final data sets are 13.838 and 13.839.

title: Ice Camp Surface Mesonet NCAR PAM-III, Maui site (PRELIMINARY)(ASCII) [Andreas, E., et al.]
Summary: NCAR portable automated mesonet (PAM-III) station (Maui site). One of six stations deployed in the vicinity (within 5 km) of the SHEBA Ice Camp. Other stations are Atlanta, Baltimore, Cleveland, Florida and Seattle. Station measures pressure, temperature, relative humidity (RH), wind speed and wind direction, energy budget parameters (4) and energy flux parameters (3). This data set contains ASCII listings of measured data and is PRELIMINARY data. The final data sets are 13.838 and 13.839.

title: Ice Camp Surface Mesonet NCAR PAM-III, Seattle site (PRELIMINARY)(ASCII) [Andreas, E., et al.]
Summary: NCAR portable automated mesonet (PAM-III) station (Seattle site). One of six stations deployed in the vicinity (within 5 km) of the SHEBA Ice Camp. Other stations are Atlanta, Baltimore, Cleveland, Florida and Maui. Station measures pressure, temperature, relative humidity (RH), wind speed and wind direction, energy budget parameters (4) and energy flux parameters (3). This dataset contains ASCII listings of measured data and is PRELIMINARY data. The final datasets are 13.838 and 13.839.

title: Ice Camp Ocean Turbulence Mast Data [McPhee, M.]
Summary: The oceanography mast experiment was designed to measure  mean and turbulent quantities at multiple levels in the  ocean boundary layer beneath the SHEBA ice floe, using  instrument clusters comprising mechanical current meters  mounted along 3 mutually orthogonal axes, with nearby SBE  temperature and conductivity sensors.  Measurements were  made from 8 Oct 97 to 28 Sep 98, with sizable gaps in  February and March due to ice camp breakup and redeployment.

title: Model ECMWF Column Output (netCDF) [Bretherton, C.]
Summary: This dataset contains column model output from the ECMWF for a chosen model gridpoint nearest the location of the SHEBA Ice Camp. This dataset contains all model output parameters for the period 22 October 1997 through 30 September 1998 in netCDF format. The file is about 60 Mb in size. This dataset is the February 2000 version which is improved over the original version because large position errors have been removed and the same forecast model version has been used (13R4) to produce the equivalent of a reanalysis.

title: Ice Camp (PRELIMINARY) Radiometer Intercomparison [Fairall]
Summary: A preliminary analysis has been done by Chris Fairall using longwave radiometer data from the SHEBA project office and the flux group (P. Guest). This analysis which contains an ASCII data file and 3 GIF figures as well as some description of the analysis procedures and preliminary conclusions is linked to here.

title: Ice Camp Deep Sonar Data [Pinkel, R.]
Summary: This dataset contains deep sonar data collected during the SHEBA Project. Each file contains 3 hour averages of ice / water relative velocity. The data were taken using 2 sonar systems, a 140 kHz sonar (pre-spring 1998), and a 161 kHz sonar (post-spring 1998). Each file is in ASCII format. MATLAB format files are also available.

title: Ice Camp Daily Precipitation Amount (ASCII) [Moritz, R.]
Summary: This dataset contains daily precipitation amounts in water equiavlent for the SHEBA Ice Camp. The data were collected by a Nipher shielded snow guage system. Measurements were made around 10 am (LT).

title: ARM Data (Link to ARM Archive) [ARM]
Summary: This data set consists of an external link to the Atmospheric Radiation Measurement (ARM) data archive. A mini-Cloud and Radiation Testbed (mini-CART) site was operated by the Atmospheric Radiation Measurement (ARM) NSA/AAO team at SHEBA for a complete annual cycle from October 1997 to October 1998.

title: Buoy, ARGOS Data [Morison, J.]
Summary: During SHEBA, the Pacific Marine Environmental Laboratory (PMEL) deployed three data buoys forming an inner buoy triangle about the central SHEBA ice camp. During SHEBA, the Polar Science Center at the University of Washington deployed 2 ARGOS Polar Ocean Profiler data buoys in ice floes approximately 50km from the SHEBA ship. Each buoy has a data file offered as an ASCII matrix.

title: Ice Camp (PRELIMINARY) CTD Yoyo Cast Analysis Depth (ASCII) (PSC) [Morison, J.]
Summary: This data set contains data from a PRELIMINARY analysis of every 10th downcast of the yoyo Conductivity Temperature Depth (CTD) between the start of SHEBA and the end of January 1998. It is made from Tim Stanton's field summary data analysis. These are the data that were shown in contour form at the March 1998 meeting. This particular data set contains data on depth, giving the 101 sample depths. See also the companion data sets containing time (13.727), Temperature (13.728), Salinity (13.729), and Density (13.730).

title: Ice Camp (PRELIMINARY) CTD Yoyo Cast Analysis Time (ASCII) (PSC) [Morison, J.]
Summary: This data set contains data from a PRELIMINARY analysis of every 10th downcast of the yoyo Conductivity Temperature Depth (CTD) between the start of SHEBA and the end of January 1998. It is made from Tim Stanton's field summary data analysis. These are the data that were shown in contour form at the March 1998 meeting. This particular data set contains data on time, giving the time of each of the 192 sample profiles in SHEBA days. See also the companion data sets containing Depth (13.726), Temperature (13.728), Salinity (13.729), and Density (13.730).

title: Ice Camp (PRELIMINARY) CTD Yoyo Cast Analysis Temperature (ASCII) (PSC) [Morison, J.]
Summary: This data set contains data from a PRELIMINARY analysis of every 10th downcast of the yoyo Conductivity Temperature Depth (CTD) between the start of SHEBA and the end of January 1998. It is made from Tim Stanton's field summary data analysis. These are the data that were shown in contour form at the March 1998 meeting. This particular data set contains data on temperature, giving the temperature at each depth level for each of the 192 sample profiles in SHEBA days. See also the companion data sets containing Depth (13.726), Time (13.727), Salinity (13.729), and Density (13.730).

title: Ice Camp (PRELIMINARY) CTD Yoyo Cast Analysis Salinity (ASCII) (PSC) [Morison, J.]
Summary: This data set contains data from a PRELIMINARY analysis of every 10th downcast of the yoyo Conductivity Temperature Depth (CTD) between the start of SHEBA and the end of January 1998. It is made from Tim Stanton's field summary data analysis. These are the data that were shown in contour form at the March 1998 meeting. This particular data set contains data on salinity, giving the salinity at each depth level for each of the 192 sample profiles in SHEBA days. See also the companion data sets containing Depth (13.726), Time (13.727), Temperature (13.728), and Density (13.730).

title: Ice Camp (PRELIMINARY) CTD Yoyo Cast Analysis Density (ASCII) (PSC) [Morison, J.]
Summary: This data set contains data from a PRELIMINARY analysis of every 10th downcast of the yoyo Conductivity Temperature Depth (CTD) between the start of SHEBA and the end of January 1998. It is made from Tim Stanton's field summary data analysis. These are the data that were shown in contour form at the March 1998 meeting. This particular data set contains data on density, giving the density at each depth level for each of the 192 sample profiles in SHEBA days. See also the companion data sets containing Depth (13.726), Time (13.727), Temperature (13.728), and Salinity (13.729).

title: Ice Camp Oceanographic Be-7 Measurements [Kadko, D.]
Summary: This dataset contains Be-7 concentrations for stations occupied during October 1997 and June through October 1998. For each sample, approximately 700 L of seawater from the upper 50m of the water column was pumped through an iron-impregnated acrylic fiber. On land, the fibers were dried, ashed, and placed in a Marenelli beaker for gamma counting. To estimate the atmospheric deposition of Be-7, samples of snow were also collected and plastic buckets were deployed to collect fallout over known time periods.

title: Model Coupled Ice-Ocean LES Output (netCDF and ASCII) [Skyllingstad, E.]
Summary: This dataset contains three dimensional data (rst files), diagnostic data (dag files), run log information (log files), virtual station data (sta files), and cross sections (slb files). Cases are described in Skyllingstad and Denbo (1999), submitted to JGR Oceans.

title: Russian Hydrographic Data [Morison, J.]
Summary: This dataset includes data files provided by the Arctic and Antarctic Research Institute through our grant Spatial and Temporal Variability of the Arctic Mixed Layer from Russian and American Data, National Science Foundation (NSF) Grant #OPP-9708635. Although this was not a SHEBA grant, the data has a strong relevance to SHEBA, because it helps put the SHEBA ocean data in historical perspective. The data set includes: Beaufort ML Quadrangle that gives mixed layer salinity and temperature from Russian hydrographic stations in a rectangle around the start position of the SHEBA drift. NPstations_2122231 includes derived mixed layer properties and representative profiles from North Pole Drifting Stations 2, 21, 22, and 31. These are in the general area of the SHEBA drift. Mixed_Layer_Depths_1970s includes mixed layer depths at Russian stations taken in the 1970s in the Arctic Ocean. Also included are files that contain averages of temperature and salinity from 148 historical Russian oceanographic stations within 100 kilometers of the SHEBA drift track for the depths indicated. Anomaly files are a collection of oceanographic stations of temperature and salinity anomalies relative to the average temperature and salinity of those stations that recorded a measurement at each given depth. The collection was chosen from Russian North Pole Station and Sever Program measurements between 1949 and 1989 within 100 kilometers of the SHEBA drift track.

title: Submarine Sonar Ice Draft Profiles [Tucker, W. B.]
Summary: This data set is an external link to a NSIDC website where submarine upward looking sonar ice draft profile data and documentation can be found. The data consist of upward looking sonar draft data collected by submarines in the Arctic Ocean. It includes data from both U.S. Navy and Royal Navy submarines. Maps showing submarine tracks are available. Data are provided as ice draft profiles and as statistics derived from the profile data. Statistics files include information concerning ice draft characteristics, keels, level ice, leads, un- deformed and deformed ice. Data from the U.S. Navy's Digital Ice Profiling System (DIPS) have been interpolated and processed for release as unclassified data at the U.S. Army's Cold Regions Research and Engineering Laboratory (CRREL) in Hanover, New Hampshire. For more information, please see that web site.

title: Surface Measurements of Freezing Leads [Pinto, J.]
Summary: This dataset contains surface measurements of leads as a part of the Surface Heat Budget of the Arctic Ocean (SHEBA) Project. Data has been compiled from Mobile Radiometric Platform (MRP) measurements and observations from the Atlanta and Baltimore NCAR Flux-Portable Automated Mesonet (Flux-PAM) stations. Observations were also made in situ and visually as reported in the logs. Included with the dataset are a read-me text file and two analysis files in PDF format.

title: Horizontal Variation in Surface Radiative Fluxes at SHEBA Camp [Curry, J. et al.]
Summary: This dataset contains imagery of the horizontal variation in surface radiative fluxes from the SHEBA camp as a part of the Surface Heat Budget of the Arctic Ocean (SHEBA) Project. Data collected during 16 missions of the NCAR C-130 over the SHEBA camp during May and July are used to document the radiative environment at the surface. Specifically discussed are the characteristics of surface albedo under cloud conditions vaying from clear to solid overcast during spring and summer. The ice surface changed considerably during this time from snow-covered multiyear ice and mostly refrozen leads in May to bare multiyear ice, meltponds and open water in July.

title: NCAR C-130 Observations [Curry, J.]
Summary: None

title: AVHRR Polar Pathfinder 5-km regional products [Fowler, C., T. Arbetter, J. Key, J. Maslanik, S. Drobot, R. Kwok]
Summary: None

Summary: None

Summary: None

Summary: None
